post_text: Supt Evans here...Tonight the Board of Trustees cut and shifted our budget to save $6.2m in 2020-21. No person was “pink slipped”, no hours cut. Some good work is gone. Still about $800k more left. This year, jobs lost - yes. Thankfully, all vacant. Less people to do the work - yes. Enough $ to open 2020-21? Yes. But, the biggest single cut in 1 year. This only gets budget harder from here. Stay positive. Let’s focus on moving forward. Our kids deserve it. Remember, what we do now with academics, arts, athletics, Career Tech...these kids will be our doctors, nurses, plumbers, vehicle repair specialists, lawyers, teachers, and yes, even a very small % ... Superintendent’s 🤪. Seriously, let’s not forget, someday one of our students, across this great state will say, “You are sick”...How educated do you want them to be? Don’t short change public education. I promise you, when that time comes, you will regret it. Chris

Every state agency will feel this, and all school will not be spared. NUSD will feel the pain. We will be forced to cut, reduce things we do not want to remove from our budget. We started yesterday by reducing District Office management positions. As we learn more, we will take more actions. We have been here before. It will be painful. Their physical/mental health and their children’s education matters. We’ll be here for them and everyone else. Love u all. Chris

March 18, 2020

NUSD Staff and Community:

In facing these unprecedented times, Natomas Unified School District CSEA Chapter 745 leaders and District leadership came together in the span of about 12-15 hours, and were able to come to two MOU agreements. The first provides classified Nutrition Service workers with time and a half for their efforts during this closure. We are so grateful they are continuing to feed our students! The second MOU provides time and half-hourly wages where appropriate and provides the framework for re-opening schools through distance learning as soon as possible.

We are appreciative that district leadership and CSEA labor partners are able to have honest conversations, take care of our employees, and to keep moving the district closer to a temporary model of distance learning. This collaboration is a model for how labor/management partnerships work.

Sincerely,

Pamela Rothwell, President - CSEA 745

Chris Evans, Superintendent

As we have shared since last Saturday, an extended weekend to address the policy and protocol effects of the Coronavirus was a possibility. Today, I am announcing the closure of our schools tomorrow Friday, March 13th, and Monday, March 16th.

This closure also means that all field trips, professional development, and extracurricular activities scheduled for this afternoon, Thursday, March 12th through Monday, March 16th are canceled or will be rescheduled. The one exception is after school programs, which will operate this afternoon, March 12 only.

If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact our CCS office at (916) 561-5253.
